sentences.sContent: Unfortunately, I am not able to prognosticate how everything will eventually shake out.
sentences.sContent_eng: Unfortunately, I am not able to prognosticate how everything will eventually shake out.
sentences.sCn: 不幸的是，我无法预言每件事的最终结果将会怎样。

sentences.sContent: It has long been fashionable for Silicon Valley visionaries to prognosticate about the direction of technology.
sentences.sContent_eng: It has long been fashionable for Silicon Valley visionaries to prognosticate about the direction of technology.
sentences.sCn: 硅谷的想象者预测了技术的发展方向流行了好长时间。

remMethod.val: pro(提前) + gno(知道) + stic + ate → 预示

trans.tranOther: to foretell (future events) according to present signs or indications; prophesy
